title: League of Legends Anime?
body:
Well, talking to a few other friends of mine GeminiPulse and Cybersonic Ace, thinking about an anime for League of Legends sounded pretty cool. Was wondering if Rito was ever thinking about it? I heard of a Manga out, but maybe an anime showing the lore of the Institute of War and the Ionia v Noxus war (stuff like that) and it could give hints on new champs or things happening to and on the rift. 
Just a thought, im not sure if its already getting talked about or something, But it would be a cool thing. Might get new players into playing League too ya know? ;) 

Please take this into consideration :)

>but maybe an anime showing the lore of the Institute of War and the Ionia v Noxus war

It's unlikely an anime of this would come out for rito mostly because of the retcon.

Like the 2 things you mentioned logistically are retcon'd (the institute no longer exists, as for the Ionia v Noxus war, not sure it can realistically exist without the Institute as otherwise Noxus would have taken Ionia and yeah)

LoL's setting and character back stories are mostly generic, besides the summoner aspect (which is pretty much Fate except that the champs are still alive instead of long dead, but now recton'ed) otherwise except a few champ's stories everything else are just bland to say the least.

Champs don't have enough connections between each other to form and develop any tangible and interesting story.

The world/Runeterra is not explored much, if at all besides some pieces here and there, without any substantial back lore to support and highlight its existence.

Too many characters hence there are only 3 ways to form the story if they really wanna attempt it:

1. Dragonball Z routine - introduce characters and world through power creeping.
2. One Piece routine - introduce characters and world through initial small cast of characters that gradually reveal the giant web of connections and relationships between nearly all elements of the story.
3. Hunter x Hunter routine - The entire world is big, alive and thriving but through the main casts' eyes you only get to see a part of the whole story.

What we currently have for LoL's lore isn't enough to reach option 2 and 3, and really option 1 is just outdated, cliche and overused by now.

I really don't think LoL's anime series would work.

You're acting as if the game content is the whole story, you could easily expand and introduce new storys and aspects to the lore using an anime. People are often to used to seeing this as a game and against the idea it could and is more then just a game, it has grown into a sport and even has fan fiction and characters made entirely by fans.{{champion:161}} {{champion:103}}
